snippet: Prime Minister Tshering Tobgay is forgoing Bhutan’s “gross national happiness” campaign in favor of modest objectives like a rototiller in every village.
abstract: Saturday Profile of Tshering Tobgay, newly elected prime minister of Bhutan; Tobgay won unlikely victory over Bhutan's governing party in July 2013 and is overseeing country of 725,000 people in midst of one of most thorough transformations in the world.
lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Tshering Tobgay is forgoing Bhutan’s “gross national happiness” campaign in favor of modest objectives like a rototiller in every village.

headline.main: Index of Happiness? Bhutan’s New Leader Prefers More Concrete Goals
headline.print_headline: Index of Happiness? Bhutan’s New Leader Prefers More Concrete Goals
